message:
I am interacting with the MCP server with name:
```
create_pr
```
and arguments:
```
{'repo_name': 'sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes', 'source_branch': 'feat/editable-feed-urls-fixed', 'target_branch': 'main', 'title': 'fix: Address code review comments - remove unused mock_fetch_and_update from test and simplify error handling', 'body': '## Summary
This PR addresses the remaining code review comments from Gemini Code Assist for the "Feat/editable feed urls fixed" feature.

## Changes Made

### Backend Test Optimization
- Removed unused `@patch('backend.app.fetch_and_update_feed')` decorator and `mock_fetch_and_update` argument from `test_update_feed_url_success` test
- The test now only mocks `fetch_feed` since the optimized implementation uses `process_feed_entries` directly

### Frontend Error Handling
- Simplified `handleEditFeedSubmit` function by removing unreachable else block
- Cleaned up error handling to directly use `error.message` for cleaner display

## Technical Details
- Backend: Test now matches the optimized implementation that avoids redundant network calls
- Frontend: Improved user experience with proper error handling and loading states

## Verification
- All tests passing (74 passed, 1 skipped)
- Backend performance optimized by eliminating duplicate network requests
- Frontend error handling improved with cleaner syntax and user feedback

This completes the code review cycle for the editable feed URLs feature.', 'draft': 'false'}
```

function.name: create_pr

args.name: create_pr

arguments.title: fix: Address code review comments - remove unused mock_fetch_and_update from test and simplify error handling
arguments.body:
## Summary
This PR addresses the remaining code review comments from Gemini Code Assist for the "Feat/editable feed urls fixed" feature.

## Changes Made

### Backend Test Optimization
- Removed unused `@patch('backend.app.fetch_and_update_feed')` decorator and `mock_fetch_and_update` argument from `test_update_feed_url_success` test
- The test now only mocks `fetch_feed` since the optimized implementation uses `process_feed_entries` directly

### Frontend Error Handling
- Simplified `handleEditFeedSubmit` function by removing unreachable else block
- Cleaned up error handling to directly use `error.message` for cleaner display

## Technical Details
- Backend: Test now matches the optimized implementation that avoids redundant network calls
- Frontend: Improved user experience with proper error handling and loading states

## Verification
- All tests passing (74 passed, 1 skipped)
- Backend performance optimized by eliminating duplicate network requests
- Frontend error handling improved with cleaner syntax and user feedback

This completes the code review cycle for the editable feed URLs feature.
